radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix appears enlarged, measuring up to 1.3 cm with mild fat stranding. There is no evidence of perforation or abscess formation. The liver, pancreas, spleen, and kidneys are normal. Gallstones are present in the gallbladder without wall thickening or surrounding inflammation. No evidence of abdominal aortic aneurysm or significant lymphadenopathy.
